text.p: Grain and oilseed exports reported by USDA and private export sources.

SOYBEAN SALE - The Taichung division of Taiwan's Breakfast Soybean Procurement Association bought a 54,000-tonne shipment of U.S. soybeans from Cargill at a tender on Tuesday. One lot of 27,000 tonnes was at US$290.91/CNF a tonne and another 27,000 tonnes was at 90.85 US cents/March for Dec 26-Jan 9 and/or Jan 10-24 shipment.

WHEAT SALE - The Cyprus Grain Commission said it accepted tenders from Nichimen Corp for 12,000 tonnes of U.S. No 22 NSIDNS or CWRS wheat at $197.22 C and F, and for 6,000 tonnes of U.S. No 2 HAD or CWAD wheat at $228.09 per tonne C and F.

SOYBEAN AND CORN TENDER - Taiwan's Hui Shung Agriculture and Food Corp will tender on Wednesday for two combined shipments, consisting of 38,000 tonnes of U.S. soybeans and 16,000 tonnes of U.S. No. 2 corn.

WHEAT TENDERS - Algeria on Monday launched two snap tenders for the purchase of a total of 100,000 tonnes of U.S. and French soft wheat for shipment in November and December, European traders said. It invited traders to submit offers on Monday, valid until Thursday, to supply 50,000 tonnes of wheat in second-half November and the rest in first-half December, they said. Traders said they had been asked to offer both U.S. and French wheat.
- Sri Lanka is to seek October 17, 100,000 tonnes optional-origin wheat for Nov 11-20 shipment.

WHEAT TENDERS - Morocco will tender on Thursday for 40,000 tonnes optional soft wheat for delivery in first half of November, the Office Interprofessionnel des Cereales et Legumineuses said. The closing date for the tender is Thursday at 1530 GMT. It said a lot of 20,000 tonnes will delivered at Agadir. The two other lots of 10,000 tonnes each are for delivery at the northern ports of Tangier and Nador.

- The CCC said it is retendering for up to 35,000 tonnes U.S. No.2 or better hard red winter, soft white or soft red winter wheat for donation to Eritrea. Shipment was slated for Oct 30-Nov 25. Offers were due by October 15.

MARKET TALK - Fears China has been cancelling soybean and soybean meal orders in the wake of tumbling world prices came as no surprise to Asian grain traders on Tuesday. "Prices have dropped US$10 (a tonne) since Friday -- there is the incentive," a Hong Kong trader said.
... South Korean corn buyers are expected to hold back further purchases of corn until early November or until prices appear to fully bottom, traders and industry sources said on Tuesday.
